meanings.definition: To beat or pulsate more strongly or rapidly than something else.
meanings.sent1: The music made my heart outthrob with excitement.
meanings.sent2: The drum's rhythm seemed to outthrob the sound of the guitar.
meanings.sent3: The outthrobbing bass made everyone start dancing.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter outthrobbed the noise of the crowded room.
meanings.sent5: The thunderstorm's outthrobbing echoed through the valley.

meanings.definition: To surpass in intensity or frequency of pulsation.
meanings.sent1: The fireworks display outthrobbed all the other celebrations in town.
meanings.sent2: His enthusiasm for the project outthrobbed everyone else's.
meanings.sent3: The outthrobbing of the neon sign caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent4: Her energy outthrobbed the tiredness of the entire team.
meanings.sent5: The outthrobbing of the engine signaled a problem that needed fixing.
